name: Pour Over Coffee
steps: Grind Coffee Beans to a Medium-Fine size (Jake likes '6' on his conical burr grinder)
Put a paper filter in your pour over maker receptical
Pour ground coffee into the paper filter such that it sits in a pointy mound
Bring Water to a boil in a gooseneck kettle
Right when the kettle stops boiling, pour over your grounds in concentric circles
Right when all the grounds ahave gotten wet, stop pouring and let sit for 30 seconds
Pour half the remaining water over the grounds in concentric circles
Once that's mostly drained, pour the rest of the water over the grounds in circles
Pour out coffee and wash everything (coffee stains pretty quick)
comments: Jake's favorite is Eight O'Clock's "The Original", which is nice because it's cheap
